samples.question: May I start with your name, please?
samples.transcript: Sure. My name is Gina. Nice to meet you, Gina. I am going to record this part of the exam for marking purposes.

samples.question: Is that okay?
samples.transcript: Yes. All right. So, the speaking interview will take about 12 to 15 minutes. There are three parts. I will give you instructions for each part.
samples.transcript_original: Yes. All right. So, um, the speaking interview will take about 12 to 15 minutes. There are three parts. I'll give you instructions for each part.

samples.question: What do you do to stay healthy?
samples.transcript: Well, I take my health seriously. I try to eat well and I do my physical exercise three times a week and I also set my health goals each month. Oh, great.
samples.transcript_original: Um, well, I take my health seriously. I try to eat well and I do my physical exercise three times a week and I also set my health goals each month. Oh, great.

samples.question: Do you believe that physical exercise is important for health?
samples.transcript: Yes, I believe the physical exercise is incredibly important for health. Human are meant to be active. Without any exercise, people may gain weight and become less healthy. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Yes, I believe the physical exercise is incredibly important for health. Human are meant to be active. Without any exercise, people may gain weight and become less healthy. Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Yes, I believe the physical exercise is incredibly important for health. Human are meant to be active. Without any exercise, people may gain weight and become less healthy.

samples.question: How often do you eat unhealthy food?
samples.transcript: Well, unfortunately, I have my unhealthy food more than I probably should. I think it is because it is very easier way to get healthy food and always the fastest option. but I limit I limit myself to eat unhealthy food once per week.
samples.transcript_original: Well, unfortunately, I have my unhealthy food more than I probably should. Um, I think it's because it's very easier way to get healthy food and always the fastest option. Um, but I limit I limit myself to eat unhealthy food once per week.

samples.question: How has people's health in your country changed in the past 10 years?
samples.transcript: In my hometown of China, I think people's health have declined in the past 10 years. I think that the food have been worsened and people many people have spending less time on getting outside do physical exercise. Mhm.

samples.question: What do you think is the biggest challenge in staying healthy?
samples.transcript: I think the biggest challenge for health for me personally I think is ignoring the fast food. well however for the society I think people should spend more time on physical exercise.
samples.transcript_original: Um I think the biggest challenge for health um for me personally I think is ignoring the fast food. Um well however for the society I think people should spend more time on physical exercise. Um.

samples.question: Are you ready?

samples.question: Are you ready to begin?
samples.transcript: Yes. Then let us start with homesickness.
samples.transcript_original: Yes. Then let's start with um homesickness.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Yes. Then let us start with homesickness.

samples.question: Do you think every person who moves from home experiences homesickness?
samples.transcript: I think the two main causes of homesickness are missing family members and the unfamiliarity of the new town. The combination of the unfamiliarity surroundings and having no loved ones around creates homesickness. I think I believe that everyone experience this even though some people who are not close as as close their family members may experience it less. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: I think the two main causes of homesickness are missing family members and the unfamiliarity of the new town. The combination of the unfamiliarity surroundings and having no loved ones around creates homesickness. Um I think I believe that everyone um experience this even though some people who are not close as as close their family members may experience it less. Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I think the two main causes of homesickness are missing family members and the unfamiliarity of the new town. The combination of the unfamiliarity surroundings and having no loved ones around creates homesickness. I think I believe that everyone experience this even though some people who are not close as as close their family members may experience it less.

samples.question: What are some ways in which a person can reduce their homesickness?
samples.transcript: I think for most people the answer is time. but for some people phoning home, making new friends, and using social media to keep to contact with family members can reduce homesickness. All right. Some people think homesickness is caused by immaturity. Others believe that homesickness can affect anyone regardless of maturity.

Some people think homesickness is caused by immaturity. Others believe that homesickness uh can affect anyone regardless of maturity.

All right. Some people think homesickness is caused by immaturity. Others believe that homesickness can affect anyone regardless of maturity.
